Armenia: After the decline of the Seljuk dominance in the region, Eastern Anatolia is ruled by a slew of Turkish emirates and tribes, such as the Ahlatshahs, Mengujekids, Saltukids and the Artuqids. (to 1241)
Belgium: Peace treaty between Henry I, Duke of Brabant and Baldwin V, Count of Hainaut, ending twelve years of conflict between the Duchy of Brabant and the County of Hainaut.
Death of Margaret I, Countess of Flanders; her husband Baldwin V, Count of Hainaut continues to rule as Baldwin VIII of Flanders
China: Guangzong was forced to abdicate in favor of his son Emperor Ningzong.
England: Richard was ransomed and returned to England.
India: Battle of Chandawar fought between Muhammad of Ghor and Jaichand of Kannauj. Ghauri defeated Jayachandra and killed him.
Malta: Malta and Sicily are ruled by the Swabians (House of Hohenstaufen). (to 1266)
